items.message: Heavy overnight rainfall has now subsided and the risk of flooding has reduced. Further showers are possible during the day but these are unlikely to be impactful.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire
floodArea.riverOrSea: River Derwent, Sea Cut, River Hertford, Burniston Beck

items.message:
River levels in the River Derwent catchment are now rising in response to prolonged rainfall. As a result, flooding of low-lying land and roads adjacent to watercourses is possible in the Derwent catchment, particularly around Mowthorpe and Low Marishes today, Sunday 14th July. 

We expect river levels in the area to peak on Sunday evening. We are not expecting to issue flood warnings in this area currently. However, we will monitor the situation and update this message should the situation change. 

Monday is expected to be largely dry, with more heavy rainfall crossing the area on Tuesday. Take care on roads and paths near watercourses which may be flooded. We will update this message by 2100 on Sunday 14th July

River levels in the River Rye catchment are now rising in response to prolonged rainfall. As a result, flooding of low-lying land and roads adjacent to watercourses is possible in the Rye catchment, particularly around Ness today, Sunday 14th July. 

We expect river levels in the area to peak on Sunday afternoon at approximately 16:30. We are not expecting to issue flood warnings in this area currently. However, we will monitor the situation and update this message should the situation change. 

Monday is expected to be largely dry, with more heavy rainfall crossing the area on Tuesday. Take care on roads and paths near watercourses which may be flooded. We will update this message by 2100 on Sunday 14th July

River levels in the River Esk catchment are now rising in response to prolonged rainfall. As a result, flooding of low-lying land and roads adjacent to watercourses is possible in the Esk valley, particularly around Lealholm and Briggswath today, Sunday 14th July. 

We expect river levels in the area to peak on Sunday afternoon at approximately 14:30. We are not expecting to issue flood warnings in this area currently. However, we will monitor the situation and update this message should the situation change. 

Monday is expected to be largely dry, with more heavy rainfall crossing the area on Tuesday. Take care on roads and paths near watercourses which may be flooded. We will update this message by 2100 on Sunday 14th July
Heavy overnight rainfall has now subsided and the risk of flooding has reduced. Further showers are possible during the day but these are unlikely to be impactful.

items.description: Coastal Streams in Redcar and Cleveland
items.message:
Heavy overnight rainfall has now subsided and the risk of flooding has reduced. 

The flood gates at Skinningrove have been reopened. We are aware of surface water flooding at Zetland Row in Skinningrove and overtopping of the flood wall at East Crescent in Loftus.  

Further showers are possible during the day but these are unlikely to be impactful.

Heavy overnight rainfall has now subsided, and the risk of flooding has reduced. 

We are aware that the flood wall at East Crescent in Loftus overtopped earlier this morning.

Whilst the level of the beck has now dropped significantly, emergency services remain on scene to assist with recovery.

Further showers are possible during the day but unlikely to be as intense or prologues as those overnight.
